body_html:
Firstly, thanks for tensorflow!

I am experiencing a similar issue. I installed tensorflow on Fedora 23 via pip. My CUDA installation seems to be working fine, as I can use the R package gputools with spectacular results. However the MNIST example fails with a misaligned memory error. My graphics card info from lspci is:

01:00.0 VGA compatible controller: NVIDIA Corporation GM107 [GeForce GTX 750 Ti](rev a2)

The attached file shows the script I'm trying to run, and the results when running with cuda-memcheck.

And here is some output from dmesg. Do you need more information? And thanks again for this wonderful software!

[30573.966313] NVRM: Xid (PCI:0000:01:00): 13, Graphics SM Warp Exception on (GPC 0, TPC 4): Misaligned Address
[30573.966336] NVRM: Xid (PCI:0000:01:00): 13, Graphics Exception: ESR 0x506648=0x3000f 0x506650=0x0 0x506644=0xd3eff2 0x50664c=0x7f
[30573.966358] NVRM: Xid (PCI:0000:01:00): 13, Graphics Exception: ChID 0028, Class 0000b0c0, Offset 00001b0c, Data 00000000
[30829.981713] NVRM: Xid (PCI:0000:01:00): 43, Ch 00000028, engmask 00000101

tensorflow-error.txt

Firstly, thanks for tensorflow!
I am experiencing a similar issue. I installed tensorflow on Fedora 23 via pip.  My CUDA installation seems to be working fine, as I can use the R package gputools with spectacular results. However the MNIST example fails with a misaligned memory error. My graphics card info from lspci is:
01:00.0 VGA compatible controller: NVIDIA Corporation GM107 [GeForce GTX 750 Ti](rev a2)
The attached file shows the script I'm trying to run, and the results when running with cuda-memcheck.
And here is some output from dmesg. Do you need more information? And thanks again for this wonderful software!
[30573.966313] NVRM: Xid (PCI:0000:01:00): 13, Graphics SM Warp Exception on (GPC 0, TPC 4): Misaligned Address
[30573.966336] NVRM: Xid (PCI:0000:01:00): 13, Graphics Exception: ESR 0x506648=0x3000f 0x506650=0x0 0x506644=0xd3eff2 0x50664c=0x7f

body:
Firstly, thanks for tensorflow!  

I am experiencing a similar issue. I installed tensorflow on Fedora 23 via **pip**.  My CUDA installation seems to be working fine, as I can use the R package **gputools** with spectacular results. However the MNIST example fails with a misaligned memory error. My graphics card info from **lspci** is:

01:00.0 VGA compatible controller: NVIDIA Corporation GM107 [GeForce GTX 750 Ti](rev a2)

The attached file shows the script I'm trying to run, and the results when running with **cuda-memcheck**.

And here is some output from **dmesg**. Do you need more information? And thanks again for this wonderful software!

[30573.966313] NVRM: Xid (PCI:0000:01:00): 13, Graphics SM Warp Exception on (GPC 0, TPC 4): Misaligned Address
[30573.966336] NVRM: Xid (PCI:0000:01:00): 13, Graphics Exception: ESR 0x506648=0x3000f 0x506650=0x0 0x506644=0xd3eff2 0x50664c=0x7f
[30573.966358] NVRM: Xid (PCI:0000:01:00): 13, Graphics Exception: ChID 0028, Class 0000b0c0, Offset 00001b0c, Data 00000000
[30829.981713] NVRM: Xid (PCI:0000:01:00): 43, Ch 00000028, engmask 00000101

[tensorflow-error.txt](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/files/310171/tensorflow-error.txt)
